original_solution_mapping.L2: She sold off 6 action figures so she has 24-6 = <<24-6=18>>18 left
original_solution_mapping.L4: She gave out 6 so she has 18-6 = <<18-6=12>>12 left

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4975.
    Returns: the number of action figures Angela has left.
    """
    # L1
    total_figures = 24 # collection of 24 pieces of rare action figures
    sold_fraction = Fraction(1, 4) # a quarter of them
    sold_figures = total_figures * sold_fraction

    # L2
    remaining_after_sale = total_figures - sold_figures

    # L3
    given_fraction = Fraction(1, 3) # one-third of the remainder
    given_to_daughter = remaining_after_sale * given_fraction

    # L4
    final_remaining = remaining_after_sale - given_to_daughter

    # FA
    answer = final_remaining
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: She sold off {sold_figures} action figures so she has {total_figures}-{sold_figures} = <<{total_figures}-{sold_figures}={remaining_after_sale}>>{remaining_after_sale} left
She gave out {given_to_daughter} so she has {remaining_after_sale}-{given_to_daughter} = <<{remaining_after_sale}-{given_to_daughter}={final_remaining}>>{final_remaining} left

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She sold off 6 action figures so she has 24-6 = <<24-6=18>>18 left
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: She gave out 6 so she has 18-6 = <<18-6=24>>24 left

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
